sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 120 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C120, the alternating group A5 × C2 × C2, or one of the 487 non-abelian groups of order 120.
message_1: Find the number of non-isomorphic groups of order 120 that can be constructed from the subtopic "Prove that every group of order 120 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C120, the alternating group A5 × C2 × C2, or one of the 487 non-abelian groups of order 120" in Group theory.
message_2:
The subtopic states that every group of order 120 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C120, the alternating group A5 × C2 × C2, or one of the 487 non-abelian groups of order 120. 

Since isomorphic groups are considered the same, we just need to count the distinct groups mentioned in the subtopic. There is 1 cyclic group (C120), 1 alternating group (A5 × C2 × C2), and 487 non-abelian groups, making a total of:

1 (cyclic group) + 1 (alternating group) + 487 (non-abelian groups) = 489

So, there are 489 non-isomorphic groups of order 120 that can be constructed from the given subtopic in Group theory.
